001package src.pkg_commands;
002import src.pkg_models.Player;
003import src.pkg_game.GameEngine;
004
005 
006/**
007 * Command class is an abstract class that serves as a base for specific game commands.
008 * 
009 * @author Pierre MATAR
010 */
011public abstract class Command
012{
013    private String aSecondWord;
014    
015
016    /**
017 * Returns the second word of the command.
018 */
019    
020    public String getSecondWord(){
021        return this.aSecondWord;
022    }//getSecondWord
023    
024    /**
025     * Sets the second word of the command.
026     * This is used to provide additional information to the command.
027     * 
028     * @param pSecondWord The second word to be set for the command.
029     */
030    public void setSecondWord(final String pSecondWord) {
031        this.aSecondWord = pSecondWord;
032    }
033    
034   /**
035     * Checks if the command has a second word.
036     * 
037     * @return True if the command has a second word, false otherwise.
038     */
039    public boolean hasSecondWord() {
040        return this.aSecondWord != null; 
041        
042    }//hasSecondWord
043    
044    /**
045     * Executes the command. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define
046     * the specific behavior of each command in the game.
047     * 
048     * @param pPlayer The player who is executing the command.
049     * @param pGameEngine The game engine that manages the state of the game.
050     */
051    
052    public abstract void execute(final Player pPlayer, final GameEngine pGameEngine);
053} // Command
